result.title: Plan
result.content:
Hello! :)

I don't know what you guys are thinking about plan, but I think it is a good idea to each week, focus on 1-2 algorithm and do lots of practise problems about that algorithm. This week and next week, there is a summer school, so I may not have as much time, but I will be free after that.

The reason I want do this as group, I tried to do these algorithms myself, but sometimes I'm stuck, cannot find problems or have hard time understanding algorithm. And sometimes when I cannot do problems, there is not even editorial (such as on SPOJ)

So here is list of algorithms I would like to cover:

String Algorithms: Hashing, Suffix Array, Prefix Function, KMP, Z Algorithm

Graph Algorithms: BFS/DFS, Dijkstra, Maximum-Bipartite Matching, Floyd-Warshall, Prim/Kruskal and MST

DP: Most people know basic concept to DP. I guess devoting a week to DP is not enough and DP takes lots of practise, so I think it is best to solve a few DP problems every week.

There are also Data Structures, but right now, I'm almost completely unfamiliar with that, so any suggestions of what to cover there would be appreciated. And if anyone else has other algorithms they think will be helpful, please post :)

By the way, if anyone has recommendations about the order of topics we should cover, please comment :) I think we should get started this week.
